column5: NEW YORK  Nov 14 The Dow and S&P 500 were on track to set fresh record highs at the open on Thursday  extending gains from late in the previous session after the release of remarks from Federal Reserve chair nominee Janet Yellen  while a slide in Cisco shares weighed on Nasdaq futures.

column4: CANADA STOCKS-TSX may open higher  Yellen's comments support
column5: Nov 14 Canada's main stock index futures pointed to a higher open on Thursday on Janet Yellen's dovish comments that supported the Federal Reserve's quantitative easing policy  ahead of a crucial nomination hearing later in the day.

column4: Western Union's CFO Scheirman to step down
column5: Nov 14 Western Union Co  the world's largest money-transfer firm  said Chief Financial Officer Scott Scheirman will be leaving the company  effective Feb. 28.

column4: BP starts new Whiting coker to swap sweet crude for Canadian
column5: HOUSTON/CALGARY BP Plc  has started up a major new coking unit at its Whiting  Indiana  refinery  sources familiar with the facility's operations said  a delayed but crucial last step in the revamp of the sprawling plant so it can run mostly heavy Canadian crude.
